intro: Cyclodium heterodon, commonly known as the African cyclodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense, circular head, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cyclodium heterodon is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
